intro: Centaurea sublanuginosa, commonly known as the downy cornflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, and it is often found in disturbed areas. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, downy appearance. The flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a distinctive central yellow disk.
